subject: Re: [junit] Knowing test-state in tearDown()?
msgSnippet: Rasmus, Sorry for the late response, but did you ever submit a feature request for this?  Thanks, David Saff On Fri, Feb 8, 2008 at 8:05 AM, Rasmus Lock Larsen
messageBody:
Rasmus,

Sorry for the late response, but did you ever submit a feature request
for this? Thanks,

David Saff

On Fri, Feb 8, 2008 at 8:05 AM, Rasmus Lock Larsen
<rasmus.lock.larsen@...> wrote:
> Hi.
>
> I would like to dump the state of the system when at test fails.
>
> So I need to know when a test fails before cleaning up the system.
>
> E.g. (java):
> protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
> if (testFailed()) {
> dumpStateForDebugging();
> }
> super.tearDown();
> }
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
